intro: Dimeria sivarajanii, commonly known as the Sivarajan's dimeria, is a rare flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its upright stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
